title.narrative: VIOLENCE AGAINST CHILDREN

description.narrative: Support national VAC coordination, development of VAC strategy, upgrading of protocols and improvement of systems' data collection and reporting, which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable children and their families are adequately supported so that their resilience to poverty and external shocks is increased and they live in a safe, non-violent family or family-like environment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Support national VAC coordination, development of VAC strategy, upgrading of protocols and improvement of systems' data collectionand reporting

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully worked with the Prime Minister’s office to endorse the new Violence against Children (VAC) strategy and the Action Plan, and initiated important knowledge-generation products to inform the further strategic engagement to accelerate progress to eliminate all forms of VAC, including an evaluation on the three-year child marriage programme, and a knowledge, attitudes and practices (KAP) survey on VAC. In response to increased risks of violence due to the COVID-19 pandemic, raising awareness on VAC was complemented with additional support to the national child helpline to expand options for reporting, counselling and referrals. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/12/2020
